(High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: generate_attestation_msg()] [Key Format Ambiguity] Can the 64-byte secp256k1_key represent both compressed and uncompressed formats, causing signature verification to fail unpredictably? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: check_subvec()] [Integer Overflow] Can start_idx + v2.length() overflow u64 bounds, causing the length check to incorrectly pass and leading to out-of-bounds access? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: check_subvec()] [Empty Vector Handling] Can v2 be empty (length 0), and does the function return true trivially, potentially bypassing validation checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: check_subvec()] [Loop Underflow] The loop uses 'iterations - 1' for indexing; can this underflow when iterations=0 is reached, causing incorrect comparisons? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: check_subvec()] [Index Calculation] Does the expression 'start_idx + idx' correctly handle all valid u64 ranges, or could large indices cause panics? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: check_subvec()] [Early Return Logic] The function returns false on length mismatch, but does it short-circuit properly to avoid unnecessary iterations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: check_subvec()] [Access Pattern] Can the reverse iteration pattern (from end to start) cause cache misses or performance degradation in large vector comparisons? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Function: test_update_msg()] [BCS Encoding Assumption] The test compares raw BCS encoding against message components; could BCS format changes break this validation approach? (Medium)
